data.name: taskVersionCombo.Items
data.value: Windows Server™ 2003, Windows® XP, or Windows® 2000

data.name: taskLocalOnlyCheck.Text
data.value: Do not store password. The task will only have access to local computer resources.

data.name: taskLoggedOptionalRadio.Text
data.value: Run whether user is logged on or not

data.name: taskLoggedOnRadio.Text
data.value: Run only when user is logged on

data.name: taskUserAcctLabel.Text
data.value: When running the task, use the following user account:

data.name: taskTriggerIntroLabel.Text
data.value: When you create a task, you can specify the conditions that will trigger the task.

data.name: actionIntroLabel.Text
data.value: When you create a task, you must specify the action that will occur when your task starts.

data.name: taskStartIfConnectionCheck.Text
data.value: Start only if the following network connection is available:

data.name: taskStopIfGoingOnBatteriesCheck.Text
data.value: Stop if the computer switches to battery power

data.name: taskWakeToRunCheck.Text
data.value: Wake the computer to run this task

data.name: taskDisallowStartIfOnBatteriesCheck.Text
data.value: Start the task only if the computer is on AC power

data.name: taskRestartOnIdleCheck.Text
data.value: Restart if the idle state resumes

data.name: taskStopOnIdleEndCheck.Text
data.value: Stop if the computer ceases to be idle

data.name: taskIdleDurationCheck.Text
data.value: Start the task only if the computer is idle for:

data.name: conditionIntroLabel.Text
data.value: Specify the conditions that. along with the trigger, determine whether the task should run. The task will not run if any condition specified is not true.

data.name: taskMultInstCombo.Items
data.value: Run a new instance in parallel

data.name: taskMultInstCombo.Items2
data.value: Do not start a new instance

data.name: taskRunningRuleLabel.Text
data.value: If the task is already running, then the following rule applies:

data.name: taskDeleteAfterCheck.Text
data.value: If the task is not scheduled to run again, delete it after:

data.name: taskAllowHardTerminateCheck.Text
data.value: If the running task does not end when requested, force it to stop

data.name: taskExecutionTimeLimitCheck.Text
data.value: Stop the task if it runs longer than:

data.name: taskRestartIntervalCheck.Text
data.value: If the task fails, restart every:

data.name: taskStartWhenAvailableCheck.Text
data.value: Run task as soon as possible after a scheduled start is missed

data.name: taskAllowDemandStartCheck.Text
data.value: Allow task to be run on demand

data.name: settingsIntroLabel.Text
data.value: Specify additional settings that affect the behavior of the task.
